doc.title: Report: body property
doc.sidebarHTML:
1. Reporting API
  2. Report

    1. body
    2. type
    3. url
  4. Related pages for Reporting API

    4. ReportBody
    5. ReportError
    6. ReportingObserver

value.content: The body read-only property of the Report interface returns the body of the report, which is a ReportBody object containing the detailed report information.

value.title: Value
value.content: A ReportBody object containing the detailed report information. Depending on what type the Report is, the object returned will actually be a DeprecationReportBody, InterventionReportBody, CSPViolationReportBody, or FeaturePolicyViolationReportBody. These all inherit from the base ReportBody class — study their reference pages for more information on what the particular report body types contain.

value.title: Examples
value.content:
js

const options = {
  types: ["deprecation"],
  buffered: true,
};

const observer = new ReportingObserver(([firstReport], observer) => {
  // Log the first report's report body, i.e. a DeprecationReportBody object
  console.log(firstReport.body);
}, options);

doc.summary:
